data.name: Precise fractions pt. 2 - conversion
data.description:
This kata is part two of precise fractions series (see pt. 1: http://www.codewars.com/kata/precise-fractions-pt-1-basics).

This time, all we need is methods for converting fractions from common to decimal and vice versa.

Your goal is to implement class ```Fraction``` with two static methods:

 - ```toDecimal(fraction)``` - takes string with common fraction representation and returns decimal representation of the same value,
 - ```fromDecimal(fraction)``` - does the opposite. Must return common fraction in normalised form (e.g. ```2/4``` would be shortened to ```1/2```).
 
In both cases, common fractions always will have form:

```[ WHOLES ] [ NUMERATOR / DENOMINATOR ]```

which means, both wholes and fractional part will be present only if needed, and if both are present, they will be separated by a single space character; eg.:

```
1
1/2
1 1/2
```

In both cases, decimal fractions always will have form:

```WHOLES [ . [ DECIMAL ] [ ( REPEATING ) ] ]```

which means that decimal part is present only if needed, and if there is repeating part of the decimal part, it will be enclosed in parentheses; eg.:

```
1
1.5
0.(3)
0.123(4)
```

The conversion is the main goal here, so there will be no "tricky" input, such as invalid strings, non-string value, or even negative numbers - just don't worry about such validation.
